title: Why is there random k-pop fancams under not related tweets? - Quora

response.answer_text: Honestly I don’t know. Many kpop fans are doing this and we are being known for it, and I don’t know why it’s so common, or why people do it so much. To promote their idols I guess. However, when someone passes, it’s not appropriate to do that. Many people are just putting the fancams on everything, and it can be very disrespectful depending on what the original post was about. I am on twitter but pretty much for only official kpop updates, as well as minecraft. So, I usually don’t see the arguements/toxicness that’s supposedly there. Although, kpoppers are posting a TON under the #whiteIivesmatter, and some people have thanked them for it because they have been drowning it out. I hope we can continue to use our power correct ways, not saying “Well if he stanned idol then maybe he wouldn’t have been hurt,” with fancams. I hope the immature fans can realize what’s appropriate and when. I don’t know, join some discord servers that are for kpop if you wanna talk that bad. I also hope more outsiders see the good fans, (usually older or multistans), and less of the bad ones. Everyone thinks that we’re all toxic since there’s a few who are. I just wanna be seen as a regular fan, just like of webtoons and certain youtubers. But to actually answer your question, I don’t really know. I think it’s fair to assume it’s to promote their idol(s), but they need to realize when it’s appropriate. Hope this helps! -Rey
